summary: Create a website similar to https://stranger-nodes-55e.caffeine.xyz/ named "tripple host", with full website customization capabilities (not only pricing) plus user login.
architectural_notes: Add authenticated admin interface to edit site content and manage pricing plans (create/update/delete), rather than hardcoded-only plans.
Admin onboarding/management should be handled via website UI (not email-based), including admin allowlist management after initial bootstrap.
Expand the admin interface from pricing-only management to broader site content customization (CMS-like editing) via the website UI.
Add support for non-admin user authentication/login in addition to admin authentication.
known_issues: Admin option/access appears to be removed in the live app, preventing the user from adding pricing plans and making site changes via the admin UI.
Version 8 is missing functionality that existed in Version 7; user requests restoring/adding all Version 7 features into the current version.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing/landing website that closely matches the structure, layout, and interactions of the reference site at https://stranger-nodes-55e.caffeine.xyz/ (same overall page sections, spacing rhythm, component patterns, and any visible hover/scroll animations), but rebrand all naming to “tripple host”.

Ensure all user-facing text content is in English and provide a single, clearly named place in the frontend code to edit the site’s copy (e.g., a content/config object) so the “tripple host” headings, descriptions, and section text can be updated without hunting through many files.

Apply a distinct, coherent visual theme for the “tripple host” site (colors, typography, buttons, cards, backgrounds) and enforce it consistently across all sections; do not use a blue+purple theme unless it is explicitly required by the reference.
Set the app’s page metadata to reflect the new site branding (document title and any visible header/hero branding) as “tripple host”.
Generate and include a simple brand logo and a subtle background/hero graphic for “tripple host” as static assets, and render them in the UI (served from frontend/public/assets/generated).

Update the Tripple Host Pricing section to show exactly two plans—Starter and Iron—with the user-provided prices and RAM amounts, using the existing centralized copy config (frontend/src/content/siteCopy.ts) as the single source of truth.
Add an admin access option in the frontend header using Internet Identity login/logout controls, and show an Admin entry point only when the logged-in principal is an admin.
Create an admin UI that allows admins to add, edit, and delete pricing plans, and persist changes via the backend; include basic validation and clear success/error states in English.
Update the landing Pricing section to render pricing plans from backend data (with a safe fallback), keeping the existing card layout and interactions.
Rename every visible CTA label that currently displays "Start Free Trial" to "PLANS" using the centralized copy config (frontend/src/content/siteCopy.ts) as the single source of truth.
Update the "Talk to Sales" button behavior so it opens the user’s Discord invite link https://discord.gg/NMcBdXYVFe in a new browser tab when clicked.

Replace the logo image for ONLY the selected element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[3]/div[1]/img[1] (the header desktop logo in frontend/src/components/landing/Header.tsx) by updating its src to a newly generated Tripple Host logo asset served from frontend/public/assets/generated, and update its alt text to "Tripple Host".

Update the centralized marketing copy (frontend/src/content/siteCopy.ts) to clearly state a strict "No Refund" policy by replacing any existing refund-positive messaging (e.g., the current FAQ item that claims a 30-day money-back guarantee) with no-refund wording in English.

Add a visible "No Refund" disclaimer to purchase-related areas of the landing page using siteCopy as the single source of truth, and render it in the UI near the Pricing and/or Contact (final CTA) areas so users see it before clicking purchase/contact actions.

Add a CMS-like admin customization system that allows admins (Internet Identity principals) to edit the landing page’s marketing content beyond pricing (e.g., header CTA, navigation labels, hero badge/title/subtitle/CTAs, stats, features section title/subtitle/items, FAQ title/subtitle/items, final CTA text, footer tagline and link labels) from the website UI, and persist those changes in the Motoko backend.

Implement a website-based “logo changer” for admins: allow an admin to upload a new logo image via the admin UI, persist it in the Motoko backend, and render the latest uploaded logo in the header (and any other existing logo locations) for all visitors.

Implement a non-admin user login experience using the existing Internet Identity sign-in/out controls, including a visible logged-in state and a basic user profile page/section that reads and updates the caller’s profile via the backend (getCallerUserProfile/saveCallerUserProfile).

Extend the backend actor (backend/main.mo) to store and serve site-wide customizable settings/content and the uploaded logo, with admin-only write access and public read access, and update frontend React Query hooks to fetch these settings and invalidate/refetch them after admin updates.

Update the existing admin entry flow so the admin panel can manage both pricing plans and the new “website customization” and “logo changer” features from a single, clear admin area accessible from the Header Admin button.

Add a frontend “Admin Setup” flow so that when a user is signed in but no admins exist yet, the UI allows the user to claim the first admin role, after which the normal Admin button becomes visible and the existing Admin Panel can be opened.

Ensure the live app experience makes the missing-admin configuration state diagnosable (instead of silently hiding admin capabilities) by showing an English explanation when a signed-in user tries to access admin functionality without being an admin, including guidance to contact an administrator if admins already exist.

Restore all end-user and admin-facing functionality that existed in Version 7 but is missing or broken in the current Version 8 build, prioritizing the admin entry/access experience so admins can again manage pricing plans, site content customization, and logo uploads from the website UI.

Implement a reliable, explicit “do any admins exist” check in the Motoko backend and update the frontend to use it so that admin bootstrap and Admin button visibility cannot regress due to heuristic client-side logic.

Restore/implement website-based admin allowlist management (Version 7 parity): provide an admin UI to view the current admin list and add/remove admin principals, persisted and enforced by the backend (admin-only write; safe read access as appropriate).
Rename the site-wide “Talk to Sales” label to “Purchase Plans” while keeping the existing behavior of opening https://discord.gg/NMcBdXYVFe in a new browser tab when clicked.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a website similar to https://stranger-nodes-55e.caffeine.xyz/ with the name "tripple host".
Add/update the Pricing section on the Tripple Host website with two plans: Starter (80 rs, 2 GB RAM) and Iron (150 rs, 4 GB RAM).
Add an admin access option (authentication + admin UI) so the user can make site changes and manage/add pricing plans.

Implement admin authorization in the Motoko backend using Internet Identity principals, including a bootstrap mechanism to establish the first admin and a way for admins to manage the admin allowlist.
Move pricing plan data to backend-managed state and expose public read access plus admin CRUD operations so pricing plans can be added/updated/removed without editing frontend code.
Rename the "Start Free Trial" CTA label to "PLANS" on the Tripple Host website.
Update the "Talk to Sales" button behavior to open the user's Discord invite link (https://discord.gg/NMcBdXYVFe).
Rename the "Talk to Sales" button/label to "Purchase Plans" across the site (and keep behavior consistent with the existing CTA/link logic).
Replace the website logo with a new "Tripple Host" logo (update the logo asset and ensure it renders in the header/hero where applicable).
Make admin access and admin management fully website-based (admin login/access and admin allowlist changes handled via the site UI), not via email.
Add a "No Refund" policy section (or clearly stated copy) on the Tripple Host website and update pricing/purchase-related text to mention the no-refund policy.
Add full website customization via an authenticated admin interface (CMS-like) to edit site content/sections beyond just pricing plans.
Add an admin "logo changer" feature so admins can upload/replace the Tripple Host logo via the website UI (not code changes).
Implement user login (non-admin user authentication) for the Tripple Host website.

Implement a website-based admin bootstrap mechanism in the Motoko backend so that if there are currently no admins configured, the first authenticated Internet Identity principal can claim admin privileges, and after that only existing admins can manage the admin allowlist.
